adjective.description: Having the form of a patella; shaped like a shallow dish or a limpet shell.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in George Samouelle (d. 1846). From patella + -iform, perhaps after scientific Latin patelliformis ( Philos. Trans. Royal Soc 50, caption to plate between pp. 855 and 856; also Linnaeus Fauna Suecica (ed. 2, 1761) 521).
